attributes.action: Allow a person of any profession who holds a UK passport to countersign a passport form
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why is it that only certain people are deemed 'suitable' to counter sign a passport application form?

If a person has worked in a clerical role for most of their life, are they not as reliable as someone who has worked as, say, a photographer?

Only certain professions seem to be able to countersign passport application forms, are these people considered to be of better moral value by our government?

I propose that the law been changed to allow any British passport holder to countersign a passport application form, providing they have worked in the same profession for however many years the government deem appropriate, regardless of which field this is in.


For a full list of those currently able to countersign please go to the UK Passport website.
